 Housing and Job Resource Centre (HOJO) 
   
 Mission 
 The CSU's Off Campus Housing and Job Bank is your on-campus resource on housing issues and workers' rights. We provide legal information to students, offer a classifieds website to find work and housing, and give workshops across campus and in the community. Visiting HOJO does not require an appointment; simply come by our office in mezzanine of the Hall Building if you have questions or require assistance. HOJO has a series of annual campaigns on themes such as unpaid internships, housing sanitation, and rental increases. 
 We offer accessible resources to find safe, clean, and affordable housing in Montreal. Our office has a computer and phones to use if you have just arrived and need a place for your search. 
 Click here to visit our classifieds website: www.classifieds.csu.qc.ca   
   
   
   
   
   
   
 Hours of Operation 
 Monday to Thursday: 10AM to 6PM 
 Fridays: 11AM to 4PM 
 Saturday and Sunday: Closed 
 Location : H-260 (Mezzanine) 
 Tel : (514) 848-7474 ext 7935 
 email:  hojo@csu.qc.ca 
 Loyola Campus Hours 
 Thursdays:1PM to 5PM in CC-426 
   
   
 You can also learn a lot about renting in Montreal from our web resource  likehome.info ,  on apartment hunting in Montreal including an interactive map that shows many Montreal neighborhoods, their average apartment rental prices, public transportation, as well as an overview of your legal rights and responsibilities as a tenant.​
